intro: Diplotaxis lagascana, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are small and hardy, allowing it to survive in harsh environmental conditions. Diplotaxis lagascana is adapted to drought and poor soil, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
